          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends for a picnic and they are discussing where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later that night.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of heading to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a good call, Jacob. Always a good atmosphere there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option.
      Jack Taylor -- "Good morning, everyone.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what are you thinking for the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a good atmosphere for watching games.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what are you thinking for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a good atmosphere for watching games.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park but is now experiencing some emotional distress because some friends are going to watch a game without him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is feeling left out because some of his friends are going to watch a game without him.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends who are present.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing some emotional distress due to the absence of some friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park but is now experiencing some emotional distress because some friends are going to watch a game without him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to ignore the pain and focus on enjoying the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is feeling left out because some of his friends are going to watch a game without him.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of heading to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a good call, Jacob. Always a good atmosphere there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option.
      Jack Taylor -- "Good morning, everyone.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what are you thinking for the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a good atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.
    Active player

    • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what are you thinking for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a good atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob, whether it's at a cafe, watching soccer games at pubs like The Princess of Wales, or relaxing in the park.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is a great choice for the game tonight.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Anywhere else is unacceptable.

As the conversation turned towards their futures, William felt a pang of unease, a sense of dissonance between the carefully constructed facade he presented and the gnawing uncertainty within. He longed for a sense of purpose, a path that would allow him to embrace the complexities of his inner world without sacrificing the control he had so carefully cultivated.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing low-level pain and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently experiencing mild pain but is about to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub called The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to ignore the pain and focus on enjoying the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he accidentally broke his mother's prized porcelain vase while practicing his drumming. Instead of confessing, he concocted an elaborate story about the cat knocking it over, even feigning concern for the feline's well-being. He spent the next few days anxiously watching his mother, relieved when she never suspected his involvement.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          Trustee Circle: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The King's Head, her preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The King's Head, her preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        TrusteeCircle
      • Trustee Circle
          Key
        • Trustee Circle
          Trusted agents
        • Alice Lewis
          Circle state
          • Alice Lewis
          • 3

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest watching the game at The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          Trustee Circle: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go to a pub with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)
        ObservationSummary

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he broke his leg during a particularly rough football match. Despite the pain and the disappointment of missing the rest of the season, he used the time off to learn carpentry from his grandfather, discovering a new passion. This experience taught him that setbacks could lead to unexpected opportunities.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to build a makeshift bar in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. They spent weeks planning and scavenging materials, working late into the night under the flickering light of a single bulb. The bar, lovingly dubbed "The Crooked Crown," became a gathering place for them and their friends, a testament to their camaraderie and Jack's burgeoning carpentry skills.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of heading to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest watching the game at The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a good call, Jacob. Always a good atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a good shout.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is an adventurous and sociable person who values experiences and connections with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert. The music was loud, the crowd was wild, and Alexander felt truly alive for the first time. He knew then that he couldn't be confined by the rules and expectations of his small town.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he impulsively decided to hitchhike across the country, leaving behind a note for his worried parents and a trail of unfinished projects. He spent weeks sleeping under the stars, meeting strangers, and experiencing the world in a way he never thought possible. He returned home changed, with a suitcase full of stories and a heart full of wanderlust.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends in Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as this aligns with his preference and his friends seem receptive to the idea.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as this aligns with his preference and his friends seem receptive to the idea.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a daring prank on his classmates, meticulously planning every detail to ensure maximum disruption and minimal risk of getting caught. He reveled in the chaos he created, the sense of control he wielded over the situation, and the bewildered reactions of those around him. The event solidified his belief in the power of manipulation and the satisfaction of pulling strings from behind the scenes.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he found himself huddled with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, in a dimly lit corner of The Princess of Wales, the warmth of the fireplace a welcome reprieve from the biting winter wind. As the conversation turned towards their futures, William felt a pang of unease, a sense of dissonance between the carefully constructed facade he presented and the gnawing uncertainty within. He longed for a sense of purpose, a path that would allow him to embrace the complexities of his inner world without sacrificing the control he had so carefully cultivated.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a daring prank on his classmates, meticulously planning every detail to ensure maximum disruption and minimal risk of getting caught. He reveled in the chaos he created, the sense of control he wielded over the situation, and the bewildered reactions of those around him. The event solidified his belief in the power of manipulation and the satisfaction of pulling strings from behind the scenes.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he found himself huddled with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, in a dimly lit corner of The Princess of Wales, the warmth of the fireplace a welcome reprieve from the biting winter wind. As the conversation turned towards their futures, William felt a pang of unease, a sense of dissonance between the carefully constructed facade he presented and the gnawing uncertainty within. He longed for a sense of purpose, a path that would allow him to embrace the complexities of his inner world without sacrificing the control he had so carefully cultivated.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Good morning, everyone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of heading to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a good call, Jacob. Always a good atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest watching the game at The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sentimental person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as it holds sentimental value for him and his friends.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who values spending time with her close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely agree to go to The Princess of Wales, even though it is not her favorite pub, to spend time with her friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015. It is currently between 6:00 PM and 6:05 PM on May 15, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling emotional pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, despite feeling disappointed that not everyone was able to make it to the pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling emotional pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a penchant for both mischief and loyalty.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of heading to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a good atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and making jokes.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a good call, Jacob. Always a good atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to ignore the pain and focus on enjoying the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White

      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is an adventurous and sociable person who values experiences and connections with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub alone and is now planning to watch another game with friends at The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we all head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
